summary: An Ordinance providing for the improvement of Twelfth Avenue South, from Holgate Street to Plum Street; Thirteenth Avenue South, from Grande Street to College Street; Holgate Street, from Twelfth Avenue South to Fourteenth Avenue South; Plum Street, from Twelfth Avenue South to Fourteenth Avenue South; Hill Street, from Thirteenth Avenue South to Sixteenth Avenue South; Walker Street, from Thirteenth Avenue South to Fifteenth Avenue South; College Street, from Fourteenth Avenue South to Fifteenth Avenue South; Fifteenth Avenue South, from Cedar River Pipe line to Atlantic Street; Fifteenth Place from Atlantic Street to Fourteenth Avenue South; all in the City of Seattle, by grading, in accordance with Resolution No. 69 of the City Council of the City of Seattle, and providing for the payment therefor by the mode of "Payment by Bonds," as provided by an act of the Legislature of the State of Washington, entitled "An act authorizing the issuance and sale of bonds by cities, to pay for local improvements, providing for the payment thereof, and declaring an emergency," approved March 14, 1899, and Ordinance No. 5693 of said city, approved December 6, 1899.
